title: Abbot
name: Tobias
summary: The Abbot is a solemn figure, his weathered face a testament to personal loss and unwavering faith. Having lost his wife, he now devotes himself entirely to his religious duties, finding solace in the rituals and responsibilities of his position.
history: Once a happily married man, the Abbot lost his wife to illness years ago. Grief-stricken, he turned to the church for solace, eventually rising to the position of Abbot. His personal tragedy has deeply influenced his approach to faith and his interactions with his flock.
notes: Often seen with a distant, sorrowful look in his eyes
Finds comfort in the flickering light of candles, which remind him of his late wife
Speaks in a soft, measured tone, as if each word carries great weight
Rarely smiles, but shows deep compassion for those in pain
